txt.en:
'I see that your great skills have advanced beyond anything I could possibly have to teach you. There is another Minstrel, one of great valour, whom I think might be of more use to you. His name is Pada, and he has travelled to a very dark place to bring hope and heart to some foolhardy dwarves who wish to reclaim a forsaken kingdom.

'Perhaps you have heard of the place: it is called Moria. Fell rumours follow that black name. I heard that Pada travelled deep within, into a Foundations of Stone, and stands there to bring light to the darkness that would make lesser folk cower and quail.

'I know a great hope-bringer when I see one, and Pada is just such a one...and so are you, for that matter. If you are willing to travel to dark places, seek out Pada in the Foundations of Stone. He will be more helpful than I.'

'I see that your great skills have advanced beyond anything I could possibly have to teach you. There is another Minstrel, one of great valour, whom I think might be of more use to you. His name is Pada, and he has travelled to a very dark place to bring hope and heart to some foolhardy dwarves who wish to reclaim a forsaken kingdom.

'Perhaps you have heard of the place: it is called Moria. Fell rumours follow that black name. I heard that Pada travelled deep within, into a Foundations of Stone, and stands there to bring light to the darkness that would make lesser folk cower and quail.

'I know a great hope-bringer when I see one, and Pada is just such a one...and so are you, for that matter. If you are willing to travel to dark places, seek out Pada in the Foundations of Stone. He will be more helpful than I.'
Minstrel: The Path of the Watcher of Resolve

'Last I heard, Pada was with the dwarf-outpost in the Foundations of Stone of Moria. Look for him there.'
You have been summoned by Pada in the Foundations of Stone in Moria in order to further your prowess as a Minstrel.

Pada has travelled to Moria to lend his aid to the dwarf-expedition that has gone to excavate the mines.\n\nPada is a very advanced Minstrel of great renown, and you should call on him to learn what he has to teach as you bring your skills to a peak.
'Last I heard, Pada was with the dwarf-outpost in the Foundations of Stone of Moria. Look for him there.'

You have been instructed to find Pada in the Foundations of Stone in Moria in order to further your prowess as a Minstrel.

'Why hullo there! If you are looking for Pada, you have found him! So stand up straight and let me have a look at you, [placeholder].

'What have we here? You certainly have a sincere look to you, and a sort of kindness in your expression. Yet you are worn with travel and toil, and sadness too. I think I know why you are here.

'Come, let us talk for a while. I can see that you are also a Minstrel of great skill, nay, not by your instrument, but by the very look of you! Did you not know that Minstrels shine with a subtle radiance? Yet we bow under the heavy burden we carry, for we give our hearts that others may endure.'

'I see that your great skills have advanced beyond anything I could possibly have to teach you. There is another Minstrel, one of great valour, whom I think might be of more use to you. His name is Pada, and he has travelled to a very dark place to bring hope and heart to some foolhardy dwarves who wish to reclaim a forsaken kingdom.

'Perhaps you have heard of the place: it is called Moria. Fell rumours follow that black name. I heard that Pada travelled deep within, into the Foundations of Stone, and stands there to bring light to the darkness that would make lesser folk cower and quail.

'I know a great hope-bringer when I see one, and Pada is just such a one...and so are you, for that matter. If you are willing to travel to dark places, seek out Pada in the Foundations of Stone. He will be more helpful than I.'
